content: That's a reasonable viewpoint. Social media companies are facing a tricky balance between preserving freedom of expression, enabling open debate, and preventing the spread of hate speech and disinformation. By regulating hate speech and fake news on their platforms, social media firms can help stymie the distribution of extreme and harmful content and ensure that debates remain civil and constructive. Still, they should do this without taking sides, so they don't prevent free speech or perception of one group or another. Ultimately, the efforts of these firms towards regulating political content could help preserve the integrity of electoral processes and the democracy that underpin them.
